description: This file implements functions for managing persistent system registry configurations, including resetting to factory defaults, importing/exporting configurations with optional encryption/decryption, retrieving configuration size, and saving configurations to flash memory. It appears to be part of a system component related to configuration storage and management within the CCSP platform.

methods.name: ANSC_STATUS PsmSysroResetToFactoryDefault(ANSC_HANDLE hThisObject)
methods.description: Restores the system registry configuration to factory defaults and deletes existing configuration files.

methods.name: ANSC_STATUS PsmSysroImportConfig(ANSC_HANDLE hThisObject,void * pCfgBuffer,ULONG ulCfgSize,void * pDecryptKey,ULONG ulKeySize)
methods.description: Imports a configuration buffer, optionally decrypts it, verifies and temporarily stores it before applying.

methods.name: ANSC_STATUS PsmSysroExportConfig(ANSC_HANDLE hThisObject,void * pCfgBuffer,PULONG pulCfgSize,void * pEncryptKey,ULONG ulKeySize)
methods.description: Exports the current configuration, optionally encrypts it, and provides the size.

methods.name: ULONG PsmSysroGetConfigSize(ANSC_HANDLE hThisObject)
methods.description: Returns the size of the current configuration file.

methods.name: ANSC_STATUS PsmSysroSaveConfigToFlash(ANSC_HANDLE hThisObject)
methods.description: Flushes the current configuration to persistent storage and marks the configuration as saved.
